page.title: 12CHURCHES
page.content: Catterline is a small village which has a small Episcopalian church. It is used only once a month. It has a grave-yard which has about thirty graves. People cannot buy ground for burial but people who bought land in the past can still be buried there. The English church was built in the nineteenth century. The walls of the church are beginning to show signs of erosion because of wind and rain. There is another grave-yard nearer the village but this is a much older one and no-one can be buried there now.The main religion of the village is Presbyterian and the people who worship in this way go to Kinneff Church or elsewhere. There are a few people in our area who are Jehovah's Witnesses. They go to Stonehaven to worship.
